About Me

Let me tell you about myself.....

BIO

My name is Sushant. I love writing code and solving problems using AI. My interest in the field of Machine Learning and Data Science carried me from Pune, India to Fort Collins, Colorado to attend graduate school at Colorado State University. As a graduate student, my masters project was based on Alternative splicing in the genomic data under the supervision of Dr. Asa Ben-Hur.

Being a grad student at Colorado State University, my coursework mainly focused on the area of Software Development, Artificial Intelligence, and Data Science. During my internship as a data scientist at JBS USA, I build an object detection model on a custom dataset using Tensorflow. As a machine learning intern at C-DAC, I worked on a Neural Machine Translation using LSTM's and attention.

JBS USA

Data Science Intern

Developed deep learning model to extract text-based data through the camera using OpenCV Designed a rudimentary data science/machine learning course for all newly hired employees, that will help them in their area of expertise.

Colorado State University

Graduate Teaching Assistant

Assist faculty members with classroom instruction, exams, grading assignments, as well as projects. Conducted lab sessions to help students to understand the fundamentals of data science, and Software Engineering. Helped students to understand SDLC, C++ concepts, CMake build system, and Bash scripting.

Colorado State University

Graduate Research Assistant

Designed predictive models to predict the anomaly in multivariate and univariate time-series data Worked on various algorithms like SVM, decision trees, LSTM, Bi-LSTM, and GRU

Centre for Development of Advanced Computing (C-DAC)

Machine Learning Intern

Built a neural machine translation system for different Indian languages that are being used by millions of people Worked on regression models such as Long Short Term Memory (LSTM) and RNN on a text-based dataset containing more than 400K sentence

Colorado State University

Software engineering Intern

Worked on a data pipeline that will simplify the analysis of next-generation sequencing for genomics (sRNA) data. The pipeline was written in CWL (common workflow language), and the python wrapper was used.

HPE

AI and Machine Learning Engineer

Developed an automation tool using Python and g8 to set up an internal ETL pipeline deployment unit, drastically reducing deployment time from hours to minutes. Utilized Spark and SQL to analyze sales data, facilitating understanding of business requirements and providing support to the sales team for data analysis. Evaluated and implemented data visualization dashboards (Superset, Tableau, QlikSense) to enable easy access to sales data for the HPE sales team. Conducted analysis of sales data to identify trends and opportunities for improvement. Assisted new graduates in transitioning to professional life by helping them find mentors and organizing networking events. Organized meet-and-greet sessions for new graduates to foster connections within the organization.
